channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on July 16
item.description:
July 16, 2020 6:23 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Thursday, July 16.Â

item.title: Two arrested after fake goods worth more than $72,000 seized
item.description:
July 16, 2020 6:14 PM

SINGAPORE - Two women have been arrested after fake goods worth more than $72,000 were seized, said the police on Thursday (July 16).

item.title: Company charged over 2 fatal workplace incidents, former factory manager fined $1,600
item.description:
July 16, 2020 6:03 PM

SINGAPORE - A manufacturer of metal tins and containers was charged on Thursday (July 16) for failing to ensure the safety and health of two of its employees, resulting in their deaths in separate incidents over a period of six months.

item.title: Armed robbery incidents in Singapore Strait hit five year high, doubling in first half of 2020
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:58 PM

SINGAPORE - The number of armed robbery incidents reported in the Singapore Strait has hit a five-year high.

item.title: Woman says she fainted on learning that her 21-year-old son raped 19 girls
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:37 PM

On June 12, her son was sentenced to 22 years in prison and given the maximum 24 strokes of the cane.

item.title: 248 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 11 in the community and 4 imported
item.description:
July 16, 2020 3:52 PM

Two Singaporeans or permanent residents, seven work pass holders and two dependant pass holders are among the community cases.

item.title: Twin joy for Singapore Zoo with birth of 2 red ruffed lemur babies
item.description:
July 16, 2020 3:18 PM

The lemur babies, which have not been named yet, are almost five months old and have begun to welcome visitors following the zoo's reopening on July 6.

item.title: 2 teens plead guilty over supermarket drink sampling incident during Covid-19 outbreak
item.description:
July 16, 2020 1:36 PM

The teenagers are out on bail of $3,000 each and they will be sentenced on Aug 27.

item.title: Approach to Covid-19 cases in schools is to ring-fence on small scale, not close schools: Education Minister Ong Ye Kung
item.description:
July 16, 2020 1:20 PM

Mr Ong's comments follow a false positive Covid-19 case in Jurong West Secondary School due to a mislabelled sample.

item.title: Science Centre, Snow City to reopen on July 17
item.description:
July 16, 2020 1:10 PM

SINGAPORE - The Science Centre and its other attractions, including Snow City and science activity area KidsSTOP, will reopen their doors for visitors on Friday (July 17).

item.title: School conversations on race and religion should continue to evolve, says Education Minister Ong Ye Kung
item.description:
July 16, 2020 12:59 PM

"This generation is different. They actually want to talk about it. But they need facilitation, and they're honest about it," he said.

item.title: CAAS freezes fee increase for aviation firms, providing industry with much-needed lift
item.description:
July 16, 2020 12:51 PM

SINGAPORE - The Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore (CAAS) announced on Thursday (July 16) that it will freeze scheduled fee increases for this financial year to mitigate the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Some BTO flats may be delayed up to nine months, up from previous six months: HDB
item.description:
July 16, 2020 12:46 PM

Some projects that are facing a longer delay are some blocks at West Plains @ Bukit Batok and SkyParc @ Dawson.

item.title: Jail terms increased for ex-GM of Ang Mo Kio Town Council and company director in corruption case
item.description:
July 16, 2020 11:12 AM

Former AMKTC general manager Wong Chee Meng's jail term was increased from 27 months to 39 months.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 16
A daily staple, key source of knowledge for many generations
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Whether read leisurely over a cup of kopi or flipped through on the MRT, The Straits Times has been the staple for in-depth coverage of news, entertainment and just about everything else about Singapore, as well as foreign developments, for generations of Singaporeans.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singapore's testing rate is tops in Asean, with over 1m swabs done
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has conducted about 177,000 swabs per million population as at July 13.

item.title: Ex-bank exec who had obscene films, child pornography jailed for 12 weeks
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

During a police raid at the home of a former senior bank executive, DVDs and other electronic devices containing 245 obscene films were seized.

item.title: Help for retrenched local RWS staff
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Local workers who were retrenched by integrated resort operator Resorts World Sentosa (RWS) will each have at least two to three job opportunities to consider.

item.title: Apple store, Bugis+ among places visited by patients
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Apple Orchard Road is among the new places visited by Covid-19 patients while they were still infectious, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: A sweet way to raise funds to support President's Challenge
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Celebrate National Day this year with some red and white desserts, and donate to a good cause at the same time.

item.title: From fear to joy: New study on feelings towards Covid-19
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The feelings of people around the world about Covid-19 have shifted from fear to anger and joy as the pandemic developed, according to a study led by Nanyang Technological University (NTU) that analysed 20 million tweets on Twitter from January to April.

item.title: M1, StarHub ex-CEO Neil Montefiore dies at 67
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The former chief executive of telcos StarHub and M1, Mr Neil Montefiore, who was known for his candid nature and foresight, has died. He was 67.

item.title: Eateries pull out all the stops to ensure customer safety
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

From rolling out digital menus to providing diners with antiseptic wipes for their cutlery, eateries here are doing what they can to keep Covid-19 away.

item.title: More safety measures at Holland Village eatery since reopening
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The Holland Village eatery that was ordered to close temporarily last month for failing to ensure safe distancing among patrons has implemented more safety measures since reopening late last month.

item.title: Tender awarded for floating platform project
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The project to redevelop the Marina Bay floating platform into a permanent space for large-scale national events has been awarded to a consultant team led by Woha Architects.

item.title: More opt for private transport as fears of Covid-19 linger: Poll
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Public transport usage may not return to pre-pandemic levels any time soon, a survey has found.

item.title: Readers catch star-studded ChildAid concert from home
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The annual charity show, which went online for the first time this year, has raised $1.95 million as of last night.

item.title: S'pore drops 2 spots to be world's 14th most costly city for expats: Poll
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has fallen two places over the past 12 months to be the 14th most expensive city in the world for expatriates and it is now the seventh priciest in Asia, according to a new survey.

item.title: RWS retrenches staff to cope with 'devastating' Covid-19 fallout
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Integrated resort operator Resorts World Sentosa (RWS) is laying off a significant number of employees as it grapples with the "devastating impact" the coronavirus pandemic has had on the tourism industry.

item.title: Uncertain future for laid-off RWS workers and those who kept jobs
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The gloomy, overcast sky on Madam Amy Low's morning commute to work at Resorts World Sentosa (RWS) seemed a portent of things to come when she found out that many of her colleagues from different departments were being called up and retrenched.

item.title: Guidelines on 'fair, consistent' sentencing of errant doctors
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

A panel headed by Justice Judith Prakash yesterday issued sentencing guidelines to help the medical profession "arrive at fair and consistent sentencing decisions", said the Singapore Medical Council (SMC).

item.title: Military detention stint strengthens his resolve to finish studies
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Once a star student in school, Mr Lee Rui Xuan felt he hit rock bottom in 2017, when he was thrown into the army's detention barracks for going Awol (absent without official leave) from camp during his national service (NS).

item.title: Babysitter admits lying to police over medication
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

A babysitter accused of poisoning two babies under her care admitted in court yesterday that she had lied in a police statement and in a court document.

item.title: Singapore GE2020: Signs of young voters' crucial role in election outcome
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

The swing against the PAP among young votersÂ might have been caused by events closer to Polling Day.

item.title: Condo, HDB rents continue decline amid pandemic
item.description:
July 16, 2020 5:00 AM

Rents for private apartments and Housing Board (HDB) flats continued their decline amid the Covid-19 pandemic, according to flash data released by real estate portal SRX Property yesterday.

item.title: Working from home has increased your electricity usage. Hereâs how to save over $800 on your bills
Apple Orchard Road store among new places visited by infectious coronavirus patients
item.description:
July 16, 2020 12:11 AM

Tekka Centre and Bugis+ were also newly added by MOH to a list of places visited by infectious patients.
